intro: Epilobium astonii, commonly known as the Aston's willowherb, is a flowering plant native to the British Isles. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, pink to purple flowers appear in clusters and bloom from June to August. Epilobium astonii is often found in nutrient-rich soils and is considered an indicator species for early successional habitats.
